detaileddescription.para: Display Driver structure to be registered by HAL

Display structure.
lv_disp_drv_t should be the first member of the structure.

Initialize a display driver with default values. It is used to have known values in the fields and not junk in memory. After it you can safely set only the fields you need.
driver
pointer to driver variable to initialize

Initialize a display buffer
disp_buf
pointer lv_disp_buf_t variable to initialize
buf1
A buffer to be used by LVGL to draw the image. Always has to specified and can't be NULL. Can be an array allocated by the user. E.g. static lv_color_t disp_buf1[1024 * 10] Or a memory address e.g. in external SRAM
buf2
Optionally specify a second buffer to make image rendering and image flushing (sending to the display) parallel. In the disp_drv->flush you should use DMA or similar hardware to send the image to the display in the background. It lets LVGL to render next frame into the other buffer while previous is being sent. Set to NULL if unused.
size_in_px_cnt
size of the buf1 and buf2 in pixel count.

Register an initialized display driver. Automatically set the first display as active.
driver
pointer to an initialized 'lv_disp_drv_t' variable (can be local variable)
pointer to the new display or NULL on error

Update the driver in run time.
disp
pointer to a display. (return value of lv_disp_drv_register)
new_drv
pointer to the new driver

Remove a display
disp
pointer to display

Set a default screen. The new screens will be created on it by default.
disp
pointer to a display

Get the default display
pointer to the default display

Get the horizontal resolution of a display
disp
pointer to a display (NULL to use the default display)
the horizontal resolution of the display

Get the vertical resolution of a display
disp
pointer to a display (NULL to use the default display)
the vertical resolution of the display

Get if anti-aliasing is enabled for a display or not
disp
pointer to a display (NULL to use the default display)
true: anti-aliasing is enabled; false: disabled

Get the DPI of the display
disp
pointer to a display (NULL to use the default display)
dpi of the display

Get the size category of the display based on it's hor. res. and dpi.
disp
pointer to a display (NULL to use the default display)
LV_DISP_SIZE_SMALL/MEDIUM/LARGE/EXTRA_LARGE

Get the next display.
disp
pointer to the current display. NULL to initialize.
the next display or NULL if no more. Give the first display when the parameter is NULL

Get the internal buffer of a display
disp
pointer to a display
pointer to the internal buffers

Get the number of areas in the buffer
number of invalid areas

Pop (delete) the last 'num' invalidated areas from the buffer
num
number of areas to delete

Check the driver configuration if it's double buffered (both buf1 and buf2 are set)
disp
pointer to to display to check
true: double buffered; false: not double buffered

Check the driver configuration if it's TRUE double buffered (both buf1 and buf2 are set and size is screen sized)
disp
pointer to to display to check
true: double buffered; false: not double buffered
Display Driver HAL interface header file
